text: Miguel Rangel, O.F.M. Cap. (1541 – 16 August 1602) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as the first Bishop of Angola e Congo (1596–1602). (in Latin)"Bishop Miguel Rangel, O.F.M. Cap." Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved September 5, 2016"Archdiocese of Luanda" Catholic- Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved September 5, 2016 ==Biography== Miguel Rangel was born in Coimbra, Portugal and ordained a priest in the Order of Friars Minor Capuchin in 1581. On 20 May 1596, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Clement VIII as Bishop of Angola e Congo. In 1596, he was consecrated bishop by Fabio Blondus de Montealto, Titular Patriarch of Jerusalem. He served as Bishop of Angola e Congo until his death on 16 August 1602. == References == Category:16th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:17th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Clement VIII Category:1541 births Category:1602 deaths Category:Capuchin bishops
title: Miguel Rangel
